Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Johnson, Michael R.
defendant.address: 13389 Big Crooked Lake Lane P.O. Box 607, Lac du Flambeau, WI 54538

records.addlTxt:
11:31 AM Defendant Michael R. Johnson appeared by video.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Michael R. Johnson.  Attorney Dennis G Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. State received counter offer from defense. Defense requests this case to track along with other two open cases going to plea and sentencing in November.  Bond continued.
Status hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:22 PM Defendant Michael R. Johnson in court, in custody Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Michael R. Johnson.  Attorney Dennis G Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights legislation has been complied with.  Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  State to e-file information in court and provides copies to defense.  Defense waives formal reading of information.  Not guilty pleas entered by court.  Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on September 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises, No contact with Officer involved,  Curfew of 7:00 pm to 6:00 am.

3:03 PM Defendant appears by video from the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Jolin appears in court, in person.  ADA Brown appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of criminal complaint. Charges read by Court. Victim rights legislation has been complied with.  Bond set at $500.00 CASH with conditions: Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises, No contact with Officer involved,  Curfew of 7:00 pm to 6:00 am.  Bond form.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
